docs.text:
Roux Sauce


Ingredients




25g Flour


25g Margarine


250ml Milk




Method




Add the flour and margarine to a pan over a very low heat. Stir
occasionaly whilst the margarine melts.


Once the margarine is fully melted, stiry well to mix in the flour
and form a dough ball.


Start adding the milk a 
little
 at a time. After each splash, stir
well until completely mixed in.
docs.title: Roux Sauce

docs.text:
Add the flour and margarine to a pan over a very low heat. Stir
occasionaly whilst the margarine melts.  Once the margarine is fully melted, stiry well to mix in the flour
and form a dough ball.  Start adding the milk a  little  at a time. After each splash, stir
well until completely mixed in.
docs.title: Method

docs.text:
Chicken and Bacon Pasta Bake in a Cheese Sauce


Serves 2


Ingredients




Pasta for two


1 Onion, chopped


3 Large Cloves of Garlic, crushed


1/2 tsp Paprika


350g Chicken Breast, diced


3 Rashers of Bacon, diced


250ml Chicken Stock


1 tsp Mixed Herbs




Cheese Sauce




250ml 
Roux Sauce


200g Mature Cheddar Cheese




Method




Put the pasta on to cook, and preheat the oven to Gas Mark 6 / 200C


Whilst the pasta is cooking, fry the onions in a little oil for 5-10
minutes, until nicely golden.


Turn the onions down low; add the garlic and paprika and fry gently
for 1 minute


Add the chicken and bacon, and fry until sealed.


Add the chicken stock and mixed herbs. Bring to the boil, then reduce
to a rolling simmer. You want to reduce to a thick coating whilst
making the cheese sauce.


Make the cheese sauce: make a roux with the flour, margarine and
milk; add the cheese and stir until melted.


Combine the pasta, chicken and cheese sauce in a casserole dish.
Place in the oven and cook for 20-25mins, until golden and crispy on top.
docs.title: Chicken Bacon And Pasta Bake
Chicken and Bacon Pasta Bake in a Cheese Sauce

docs.text: Pasta for two  1 Onion, chopped  3 Large Cloves of Garlic, crushed  1/2 tsp Paprika  350g Chicken Breast, diced  3 Rashers of Bacon, diced  250ml Chicken Stock  1 tsp Mixed Herbs

minutes, until nicely golden.  Turn the onions down low; add the garlic and paprika and fry gently
for 1 minute  Add the chicken and bacon, and fry until sealed.  Add the chicken stock and mixed herbs. Bring to the boil, then reduce
to a rolling simmer. You want to reduce to a thick coating whilst
making the cheese sauce.  Make the cheese sauce: make a roux with the flour, margarine and
milk; add the cheese and stir until melted.  Combine the pasta, chicken and cheese sauce in a casserole dish.
Place in the oven and cook for 20-25mins, until golden and crispy on top.
docs.title: Method

docs.text:
Chicken Mole with Coriander & Lime Rice


Serves 2


Ingredients


Sauce




1 Ancho Chillie


1 Onion, chopped


1 tsp Cumin, ground


1 tsp Coriander, ground


350g Chicken, diced


2 Garlic Cloves


25g Raisins


1 tbsp Peanut Butter


1 Cinnamon stick


1 tbsp Lime Juice


150ml Sour Cream


12.5g Milk Chocolate




Rice




160g Basmati Rice


Bunch of Coriander, chopped


Zest of 1 Lime, juice of half.




Method




Slice the chillies in half; remove the seeds and stalk. Dry fry in a 
pan for 1-2 mins until they smell fragrant. Remove from pan, place in a 
bowl and cover with 300ml of boiling water. Soak for at least 20 
minutes.


Whilst the chillies are soaking, gently fry the onions for 10 
minutes until golden. Turn down the heat, and add the cumin and 
coriander; fry gently for 1-2 minutes.


Add the chicken and fry until sealed.


Whilst the chicken is cooking, place the chillies and liquid into a 
blender. Add the garlic, raisins & peanut butter, and blend until 
smooth.


Add the blended chillie sauce to the pan; add the cinnamon stick & 
lime juice and stir in the sour cream & chocolate. Bring to the boil, 
reduce the heat and simmer for 20-30 mins.


Cook the rice according to your prefered method. Whilst cooking, chop 
the coriandor and grate the lime zest. When the rice is done, drain and 
add the coriander, lime zest and lime juice.
docs.title: Chicken Mole
Chicken Mole with Coriander & Lime Rice

docs.text: 1 Ancho Chillie  1 Onion, chopped  1 tsp Cumin, ground  1 tsp Coriander, ground  350g Chicken, diced  2 Garlic Cloves  25g Raisins  1 tbsp Peanut Butter  1 Cinnamon stick  1 tbsp Lime Juice  150ml Sour Cream  12.5g Milk Chocolate

docs.text: 160g Basmati Rice  Bunch of Coriander, chopped  Zest of 1 Lime, juice of half.

docs.text:
Slice the chillies in half; remove the seeds and stalk. Dry fry in a 
pan for 1-2 mins until they smell fragrant. Remove from pan, place in a 
bowl and cover with 300ml of boiling water. Soak for at least 20 
minutes.  Whilst the chillies are soaking, gently fry the onions for 10 
minutes until golden. Turn down the heat, and add the cumin and 
coriander; fry gently for 1-2 minutes.  Add the chicken and fry until sealed.  Whilst the chicken is cooking, place the chillies and liquid into a 
blender. Add the garlic, raisins & peanut butter, and blend until 
smooth.  Add the blended chillie sauce to the pan; add the cinnamon stick & 
lime juice and stir in the sour cream & chocolate. Bring to the boil, 
reduce the heat and simmer for 20-30 mins.  Cook the rice according to your prefered method. Whilst cooking, chop 
the coriandor and grate the lime zest. When the rice is done, drain and 
add the coriander, lime zest and lime juice.
